title: The Researcher's Despair
key_events: Dr. Okonkwo working through night, 47 days of research, zero cure progress
Colonel Reeves demands official assessment for Pentagon
Pentagon considering termination, needs legal status determination
Marie admits transformation is irreversible without lobotomy
Lena texts asking about Adrian, Marie tells her he's beyond retrieval
Marie must write assessment that may justify execution
Struggles between truth and hope, data and humanity

character_development.Dr. Marie Okonkwo: Exhausted, despairing, recognizing she can't save them, haunted by son's memory, must decide if Changed count as human
character_development.Colonel Reeves: Pushing for termination authorization, sees Changed as existential threat, fear-driven pragmatism

planted_elements: Pentagon assessment deadline - will determine Changed fate
Exponential growth projection of Changed population
Marie's guilt paralleling her inability to save her son
transformation_stage: Observed from outside - Changed at Stage 2 late/Stage 3 early, Marie documenting but unable to help
cosmic_horror_elements: Beautiful transformation indistinguishable from horrible loss
Data offering no answers, only questions
Hope as delusion maintained despite evidence
Species-level decision about who counts as human
Watching people disappear and being unable to stop it
themes: The impossibility of saving those beyond saving
Hope as human trait even when irrational
Legal personhood as social construct tested by transformation
Documentation as last act when intervention fails
